physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Strength of left side was 1/5 (MRC Scale) during the headache, improving to 4/5 (MRC) at the end of each migraine headache with mild weakness persisting between attacks.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially severe migraine attacks associated with left-sided hemiparesis and eyelid ptosis; frequency of attacks reduced after treatment with IV verapamil, with the patient reporting only mild headaches and minimal left arm weakness at 2-month follow-up.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Examination showed extrapyramidal signs (bradykinetic gait, generalized rigidity) and cerebellar signs (staccato voice, bilateral dysmetria).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Neurologic examination improved one week after lithium concentration was reduced; no recurrence of headache and a normal neurologic examination at last follow-up.
